\def \articleTITLE{[Re] Predictive model for the size of bubbles and droplets created in microfluidic T-junctions}
\def \articleTYPE{Replication}
\def \articleDOMAIN{Microfluidics}
\def \articleBIBLIOGRAPHY{bibliography.bib}
\def \articleYEAR{2023}
\def \reviewURL{}
\def \articleABSTRACT{Microfluidic T-junctions are used for creating dispersed bubbles or droplets of a consistent volume. Such platforms have been used for a variety of applications, such as [...], [...], and [...]. It is often critical that the volume of the bubbles or droplets are consistent and predictable. A mathematical model was previously developed for predicting the volume of bubbles and droplets formed in microfluidic T-junctions, however, their code was not made readily available. In this work, we develop Python modules that implement the mathematical model and replicate the figures in the original work. While the model could be replicated, some results shown in the original work were flawed while others could not be replicated exactly.}
\def \replicationCITE{van Steijn V., Kleijn C.R., Kreutzer M.T., Predictive model for the size of bubbles and droplets created in microfluidic T-junctions. Lab Chip, 2010,10, 2513-2518}
